io.jenetics.ext.util

Class FlatTreeNode<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jenetics.ext.util.FlatTreeNode<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FlatTree<T,FlatTreeNode<T>>, Tree<T,FlatTreeNode<T>>, Serializable, Iterable<FlatTreeNode<T>>

    public final class FlatTreeNode<T>
extends Object
implements FlatTree<T,FlatTreeNode<T>>, Serializable
    Default implementation of the FlatTree interface. Beside the flattened and dense layout it is also an immutable implementation of the Tree interface. It can only be created from an existing tree.
    final Tree<String, ?> immutable = FlatTreeNode.of(TreeNode.parse(...));
    Since:
    3.9
    Version:
    5.0
    Author:
    Franz Wilhelmst√∂tter
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    Implementation Note:
    This class is immutable and thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public FlatTreeNode<T> getRoot()
        Returns the root of the tree that contains this node. The root is the ancestor with no parent. This implementation have a runtime complexity of O(1).
        Specified by:
        getRoot in interface Tree<T,FlatTreeNode<T>>

        the root of the tree that contains this node

        public ISeq<FlatTreeNode<T>> flattenedNodes()
        Description copied from interface: FlatTree

        final ISeq<T> seq = getRoot().breadthFirstStream() .collect(ISeq.toISeq());
        Specified by:

      • stream

        public Stream<FlatTreeNode<T>> stream()
        Return a stream of all nodes of the whole underlying tree. This method call is equivalent to
        final Stream<FlatTreeNode<T>> nodes = getRoot().breadthFirstStream();
        Specified by:
        stream in interface Tree<T,FlatTreeNode<T>>
        Returns:
        a stream of all nodes of the whole underlying tree

        public <B> ISeq<B> map(Function<FlatTreeNode<T>,? extends B> mapper)
        Return a sequence of all mapped nodes of the whole underlying tree. This is a convenient method for
        final ISeq<B> seq = stream() .map(mapper) .collect(ISeq.toISeq())
        Type Parameters:
        B - the mapped type
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • parse

        public static FlatTreeNode<String> parse(String tree)
        Parses a (parentheses) tree string, created with Tree.toParenthesesString(). The tree string might look like this: 
          mul(div(cos(1.0),cos(œÄ)),sin(mul(1.0,z)))
        Parameters:
        tree - the parentheses tree string
        Returns:
        the parsed tree
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given tree string is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given tree string could not be parsed
        Since:
        5.0
        See Also:
        Tree.toParenthesesString(Function), Tree.toParenthesesString(), TreeNode.parse(String)

      • parse

        public static <B> FlatTreeNode<B> parse(String tree,
                                        Function<? super String,? extends B> mapper)
        Parses a (parentheses) tree string, created with Tree.toParenthesesString(). The tree string might look like this 
          0(1(4,5),2(6),3(7(10,11),8,9))
        and can be parsed to an integer tree with the following code:
        final Tree<Integer, ?> tree = FlatTreeNode.parse( "0(1(4,5),2(6),3(7(10,11),8,9))", Integer::parseInt );
        Type Parameters:
        B - the tree node value type
        Parameters:
        tree - the parentheses tree string
        mapper - the mapper which converts the serialized string value to the desired type
        Returns:
        the parsed tree object
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given parentheses tree string doesn't represent a valid tree
        Since:
        5.0
        See Also:
        Tree.toParenthesesString(Function), Tree.toParenthesesString(), TreeNode.parse(String, Function)
